author: GamingBolt
description:
Escape from Tarkov – Battlestate Games’ ruthlessly realistic extraction shooting pioneer - is finally reaching its full version release on November 15th. Mythologised and feared in equal measure, Tarkov veterans have endured the shooter’s suffering combat since the beta launched back in 2017. 

Since then, countless extraction-based shooters have emerged; many taking cues from Tarkov’s blueprint – ARC Raiders, Arena Breakout: Infinite, and Marathon are each having their moment, good or bad. The questions now are: is Escape from Tarkov coming too late to dominate the space it created? 

Will the brutality in its 1.0 version entice, and retain, newcomers? Will veteran players’ devotion last beyond the final version’s release? Even with an increase in competition, Escape from Tarkov still offers a unique experience. It’s now down to Battlestate to reward player loyalty; to prove their suffering has been worth it all along.
title: Escape From Tarkov 1.0 Release NEEDS To Reward Player Loyalty, Prove The Suffering Was Worth It

author: GamingBolt
description:
“You can never have enough Call of Duty,” said no one ever, and hence, Activision readies its second consecutive Black Ops title in a year. Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 launches on November 14th for Xbox Series X/S, PS5, PC, Xbox One, and PS4, and sends players back to the future, ten years after the events of Black Ops 2. Somehow, Raul Menendez has returned, and it's up to David Mason to stop him.

But what else differentiates this year's entry from Black Ops 6? Let's dive into 15 of the biggest factors, from new multiplayer modes and scorestreaks to their post-launch support.
title: Call of Duty Black Ops 7 vs  Black Ops 6: 15 BIGGEST Changes You Need To Know Before You Purchase

author: GamingBolt
description:
For a genre with such a simple purpose, laden with layers of complexity, ARC Raiders offers perhaps the most refined approach seen yet. It's brimming with personality, as evidenced in its presentation and incredible music, but never threatens to overpower the extraction gameplay and topside tension. 

Approachable yet complex; forgiving yet just as unrelenting if you so choose, it's one of the most enjoyable multiplayer shooters in years.
title: Arc Raiders Review - This Is How You Do A Extraction Shooter
